intro: Tetranthera cauliflora, commonly known as the climbing tetranthera, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its twining habit and the presence of small, clustered flowers that often appear in the axils of the leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically borne in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tetranthera cauliflora is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
